about.heading: Currently Teaching Python Fundamentals
about.text1: I am a Python tutor currently studying at York University, Canada. I specialize in teaching beginners the foundations of programming in a clear, step-by-step manner.
about.text2: My goal is to make coding accessible and practical for every student. Whether you are a high school student or a university beginner, I structure my lessons to build confidence and real-world skills.

faq.q: Is this suitable for absolute beginners?
faq.a: Yes, absolutely! No prior programming knowledge is required. We start from the very basics like installing Python and writing your first line of code.
Yes, I offer personalized online sessions tailored to your specific learning goals and pace.

faq.q: What age group do you teach?
faq.a: I primarily teach high school students and university beginners, but I am open to anyone willing to learn!
You need a computer (PC/Mac) and access to the internet. We will set up VS Code and Python together in the first lesson.

challenges.title: ⚡ Mini Code Challenge
challenges.subtitle: Test your logic! What does this code output?
challenges.code:
x = 5
for i in range(3):
    x += i
print(x)
challenges.explanation: x starts at 5. Loop runs for i=0, 1, 2. 5+0+1+2 = 8

intro.title: Structured Python Programs for Young Learners
intro.desc:
Each program is carefully designed to build confidence, problem-solving ability, and real programming skills through guided instruction and hands-on projects.

Students progress at their own pace in small-group or one-on-one settings, ensuring personalized support and meaningful growth.

levels.title: Python Foundations
levels.desc: This program introduces the fundamentals of coding in a structured and supportive environment. Students build a strong foundation in core programming concepts while developing logical thinking and confidence.
outcomes: Strong understanding of core programming principles
Ability to write and modify simple programs
Comfort with debugging and fixing errors
levels.summary: By the end of this program, students are comfortable writing beginner-level Python programs independently.

levels.title: Python Development & Creative Coding
levels.desc: This program strengthens problem-solving skills and introduces students to structured program development. Designed for students ready to build more advanced projects.
outcomes: Stronger logical reasoning and structured thinking
Ability to organize and manage larger programs
Creative coding skills through visual and interactive projects
Improved independence in reading and modifying code
levels.summary: By the end of this program, students are able to confidently design and build multi-part Python programs.

philosophy.title: Teaching Philosophy
philosophy.subtitle: Project-Based. Student-Centered. Confidence-Focused.
points: Every concept is reinforced through building.
Students are encouraged to experiment and ask questions.
Mistakes are treated as part of the learning process.
Learning is paced to ensure understanding — not speed.
philosophy.conclusion: The goal is not just to teach Python, but to help students think like programmers.

sessions.title: How Sessions Work
sessions.subtitle: Small Group or 1:1 Format
sessions.desc: Sessions are conducted online in small groups (maximum 3 students) or one-on-one.
sessions.flexibility: Sessions are structured but flexible, adapting to each student's pace.

tools.title: Tools & Setup
tools.support: Setup assistance can be provided before the first session if needed.

communication.title: Communication & Support
points: All class-related communication is handled through a dedicated parent communication platform.
Students also have access to a space where they can ask questions outside of class time to encourage continued learning and curiosity.
Parents are welcome to reach out with questions at any time.

payment.title: Payment Structure
payment.note: Specific details are discussed directly with families. If a session is missed, rescheduling may be arranged whenever possible with advance notice.
